In the people's pharmacy health headlines
French scientists have added a new entry to the debate over organic food

In a seven year study more than sixty eight thousand French adults reported on their diets those who consumed organic food most often were twenty five percent less likely to be diagnosed with cancer during the study that works out to a difference of six cases per thousand people
There were more than Thirteen hundred initial cancer cases reported organic food consumers were significantly less likely to develop post menopausal breast cancer or non Hodgkin's lymphoma
The investigators hypothesize that lower burdens of pesticides in the organic foods might contribute to this affect
The study is observation also it doesn't prove the cause and effect relationship more over the researchers admit that high prices are a major obstacle for buying organic foods
Nonetheless they conclude although the study findings need to be confirmed promoting organic food consumption in the general population could be a promising preventive strategy against cancer
A comprehensive review of research linking herpes virus infection to senile dementia or Alzheimer's disease was just published in frontiers in aging earth science
According to the author recent evidence implicates role for it just the one the virus that causes cold sores

It seems especially likely to affect people with April e for gene variant in one study anti viral treatment of herpes virus infections with drugs like a cycler beer fan cycler beer or valor cycler beer dramatically reduce the likelihood of developing dementia

And that epidemiological study roughly twenty eight percent debate just be patient develop dementia during the tenure follow up among similar patients treated with anti viral drugs fewer than six percent progress to dementia

The author bemoan the fact that scientists have been overlooking research data linking infections that old timers disease for three decades she concludes surely now is the time to rectify the situation by determining and then using the best means of treatment at hand
Many people think of lavender as a calming herb research in mice now shows that this reputation goes beyond folklore

When they expose myself to the ... compound a little the little from lavender the scientists found that the mice acted less anxious unlike a ... such as al ... also reduces anxiety little little does not affect the animal's ability to move around
The compound works through the sense of smell since animals with an impaired sense of smell did not respond to lend a little
The investigators hope this will lead to better anxiety treatment for humans who might be facing surgery or other frightening situations

Plastic is ubiquitous in our environment it's found in nearly all packaging of consumer goods there are massive quantities in the ocean and in landfills and now researchers report that it's in the U.S as well

A small study that included eight participants from Japan Russia and Europe found tiny particles of plastic in their stool nine different types of plastic were detected out of the ten researchers were looking for polypropylene and P. E. T. were the most common no one knows the implications of this finding
How widespread is plastic contamination of the human digestive tract
Scientists suspect that perhaps half the people on earth carry micro plastic around in their guts but this has not been proven

They also do not know whether micro plastic particles might alter immune responses or effect hormonal systems what is clear is that we cannot continue to add plastic to our environment and expect to remain unaffected

But and we used to think about osteoarthritis as sort of wear and tear up the joints but it turns out that that paradigm is is probably not true

I mean certainly aging and using your joints may increase the risk that you damage your joints but not everybody who ages or over uses their joints get to that kind of damage so we think there are probably a very complicated

And many patients don't think to tell their rheumatologist about that
Um and I think that's very important and and sometimes the dryness can be very very profound

Rheumatoid arthritis can also involve the lungs many patients with rheumatoid arthritis will have interest dish or lung disease or inflammation of their long for most patients it's not clinically important but rarely some patients can have very severe lung disease that can be life threatening
Um it can involve the nervous system um it can involve the heart of and we know that inflammation in general

Can lead to cardiovascular disease and that is true in rheumatoid arthritis and really other forms of autoimmune disease such it's lupus um that we often see an increased a rate of cardiovascular disease even among young women

I've heard that that can be counterproductive on occasion can you help us understand the the benefits and risks of a cortisone type injection into a joint
There's no doubt that many patients with arthritis will get good relief with a steroid injection and for some patients that can last a good long time so it's a very good option for many patients
The concern is is that over time often there is a sort of laws diminishing returns and so they last

You know they don't last as long as they did initially and so people get repeated injections there's some concern that repeated critical to your injections into a joint may increase the risk of the development of osteoarthritis the data around that are really not altogether clear

That kids are story um is not altogether clear we know that patients with rheumatoid arthritis regardless of the ... of whether they've been on any of these medicines are at higher risk for lymphoma and leukemia so teasing out how much of this is the underlying disease and how much of the drug is unclear

But I have um you know a sense that the risk of cancer lymphoma leukemia solid cancers is actually not um significantly increased and there are now a lot of epidemiologic studies out there that are really supporting that but infection absolutely
